content.rendered:
Poker Strategies you need to know about

Every gambler needs easy to remember poker tips to ensure they have a competitive advantage over their opponents. 

When you know the right moves to make, you’ll gamble with confidence and increase your affinity for winning. 

To be a profitable poker player, you should use each opportunity to improve your skills. Whether you’re playing live poker, tournaments or even in poker rooms, you should strive to be the better opponent. 

Here are poker strategies to help you be the best gambler you could ever be.

  1. Aggressively Play Fewer Hands 

There is really no limit on the number of hands you can play. However, you should strive to play fewer hands. When you’re playing too many hands, you’ll end up bleeding away your chip stack. 

Instead of playing many hands, focus on developing a solid pre-flop poker strategy. Understand that strategy development is the easy part because many gamblers have a hard time sticking to their plan. 

If you can, download reliable pre-flop charts and ensure you play patiently. Head over to BeastOfPoker to find the best poker deals and poker sites. 

Impatience can mess up even the world’s best players because you’ll end up playing a hand that’s not worth playing.

Focus on playing a tight range of strong hands and do this aggressively. This approach allows you to disguise the strengths of your individual hands. Whether you’re playing a playable hand, or more speculative ones, your opponent won’t know the difference. 

This makes you a very strong opponent because your wins will take other gamblers by surprise. Playing a tight and aggressive poker game is the best way to secure the bag.

  • Don’t be the First to Limp

If you want to win, you should never be the first player to limp. This is an absolute no-no because you’re unlikely to win the pot prior to the flop like you could if you raised. 

When you’re the first to limp, you’re giving other players behind you, enticing odds. This means that you’ll be at a disadvantage and on top of this, you’ll end up facing multiple players. 

The ideal time to limb is when another player has already limped. Over-limping is a good play because you get great pot odds which allows you to hit another play on the flop.

  • Semi-Bluff Aggressively with your Draws

The secret to crushing poker is learning how to bluff effectively. This is a tricky play because when you bluff ineffectively, you can easily lose everything. 

So how do you ensure the opponents believe you when you bluff? 

First, you need to keep your bluffing frequency under control because if you’re always bluffing, opponents see it coming. 

The most effective way to do this is to let your cards dictate if it’s an ideal time to bluff or not. This means you should only bluff when the outcome improves your best hand on a later street. 

For instance, if you have flush draws, straight draws, or even an over-card, you have a backup plan in case your bluff gets called. 

These are called semi-bluffs because even when your bluff gets called, there’s still potential beyond the bluff itself. When you’re just starting out as a poker player, avoid bluffing until you get the hung of the game. 

  • Fast-Play your Strong Hands to Build the Pot 

When you have strong hands, don’t be afraid to play them fast and chase your opponent out of the pot. 

When you bet your strong hands, you build your pot and ultimately win more money. Fast playing strong hands also protect your equity. 

That said, you should not always raise your strong hands post-flop.

Here are instances where it’s okay to check your strong hand.

  • When it’s unlikely that you’ll be outdrawn 
  • When there are few scare cards stopping you from getting money on later streets
  • When your opponent has more hands that don’t have showdown value

However, when you’re uncertain of the stakes, just check-raise; especially if you were not the pre-flop aggressor. 

  • Fold When you’re Unsure

The difference between a bad poker player and a professional is knowing when you’re beaten. Before you start playing poker, you should understand that you will not always win. You’re bound to meet better players online every once in a while.

It might sound simple to do, but even the best poker players find it very hard to fold. Everyone naturally wants to win, and folding is surrendering your chance of winning. 

Each time you’re unsure whether you should call or fold, the best move is to fold.

Conclusion 

Poker is an intriguing game because it’s always testing your limits. You need easy to learn tricks that help you think fast on your feet. Ensure you train yourself to be a patient player because playing fast can easily cost you a win.
